intro: Bembicidium, commonly known as the parasitic orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orchidaceae. These plants are hemiparasitic, meaning they derive some nutrients from their host plants while also performing photosynthesis. Bembicidium species typically grow on the stems of other plants, often in tropical and subtropical regions. They have specialized roots that attach to their hosts, allowing them to absorb water and minerals. The flowers of Bembicidium are usually small and delicate, often with a distinctive coloration that aids in pollination.
